org.persona.ontology
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  org.persona.middleware.PResource
      org.persona.ontology.ManagedIndividual
          org.persona.ontology.ComparableIndividual
              org.persona.ontology.Location
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable
public abstract class Location
extends ComparableIndividual

A location is the ontologic object that represents a physical thing position in the space. A location can have 3 properties: HAS_POSITION, IS_IN PLACE, and IS_NEAR_ADDRESS. A location position can be absolute (i.e. a GPS global position) or relative (in such case the referring system is related to the place indicated in IS_IN_PLACE attribute). It is possible to indicate a location without using a position, but in this case the IS_IN_PLACE attribute must be present. IS_IN_PLACE represents the place when the subject is located. There are 4 different kind of places (please read PLACE ontology). IS_NEAR_ADDRESS represents a physical address near to the location. This attribute doesn't state that the location is inside the building, but it can be also used for outdoor locations.

Author:
smazzei

getDistanceTo

public abstract float getDistanceTo(Location other)
Returns the distance (meters) between the current location and the argument location. This is an estimation of the actual distance between locations. The following cases are possible (let's consider the distance between location A and location B):
  1. A and B "has_position" attribute is present and it is an absolute position. The method returns the distance between A and B GPS positions applying Euler's theorem (i.e. ignoring altitude).
  2. A and B "has_position" attribute is present and it is a relative position. In this case there are two options:
    • A and B his_in_place attributes are both present and they have the same global position (i.e. they refer to the same coordinate system). Compute the distance between A and B using their relative positions and Manhattan distance algorithm. For buildings with more than one floor, lifts / stairs positions are taken in account.
    • A and B his_in_place attributes are both present and they have different global positions. In this case the method takes in account only the places global positions and compute their distance using Euler's theorem.
    A and B "has position" attribute is NOT present, but "is in place" attribute is present. Calculate d(A,B) using their "is in place" places coordinates.
  3. In any other case A or B are not well formed and the method returns NOT_COMPUTABLE_DISTANCE.

hasConnectionTo

public abstract boolean hasConnectionTo(Location other)
Returns:
true if two locations are in connected places. If at least one location doesn't have "is in place" property the method returns false.

isAdjacentTo

public abstract boolean isAdjacentTo(Location other)
Returns:
true if two locations are in adjacent places. If at least one location doesn't have "is in place" property the method returns false.

compareTo

public abstract int compareTo(Object arg0)
Returns:
zero if current location and argument location are in the same Place.
-1 if current location is in a Place contained in argument location Place.
1 if argument location is in a Place contained in current location Place.
NOT_COMPARABLE_LOCATIONS if two locations are not comparable.
